byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Dan Bilefsky from London; Kimberly Bradley from Vienna; Matthew Brunwasser from Sid, Serbia; Boryana Dzhambazova from Edirne, Turkey; Rick Gladstone from New York; Emmarie Huetteman and Katarina Johannsen from Deggendorf, Germany; Palko Karasz from Budapest; Joseph Orovic from Tovarnik, Croatia; and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.
byline.original: By RICK LYMAN and HELENE BIENVENU

abstract: Hungarian riot police carry out violent crackdown on migrants massing at country's border and demanding to be allowed to cross through country to Europe; new law passed in Hungary stipulates migrants will not be allowed to cross border until finger-printed and approved; scene is likely to repeat itself as migrant crisis continues.
lead_paragraph: Officers beat migrants with batons, doused them with water cannons and sprayed them with tear gas at the border with Serbia. Thousands of migrants sought alternate routes west.

headline.main: Migrants Clash With Police in Hungary, as Others Enter Croatia
headline.print_headline: Migrants and Police Clash During Border Crackdown by Hungary

snippet: Officers beat migrants with batons, doused them with water cannons and sprayed them with tear gas at the border with Serbia. Thousands of migrants sought alternate routes west.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
